info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 27 at 2:05PM CDT until August 29 at 2:14AM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wichita KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas...
West Branch Walnut River at El Dorado affecting Butler County.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...West Branch Walnut River at El Dorado.
* WHEN...From Thursday morning to early Friday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, North and south of the river gage bridge, flood waters cover parts of Main St near 6th Avenue and 12th Avenue. Flooding also affects the streets between SW 40th and SW 50th along SW Haverhill Road, located southwest of the city.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 23.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 215 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING
